items.text: now Hope finds the boundary. Length ball on off stump and Hope takes a step forward, plants his left foot away from the line of the ball, and flat-bats it between bowler and mid-off
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: full, nearly in the blockhole on off stump, clipped down to long-on
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.text: full on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Holder, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, drifts down leg. Holder can't put bat onto ball as he tries to glance it fine
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 wide

items.text: full outside off, stretches forward to drive to mid-off
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: fullish on off stump, clipped down to long-on
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Tadj: "i will say it and continue to say it. Jason holder is not a finisher, he is a batsman. Please bat at 5 in the order, technically sound and has Test credentials."
items.text: back of a length, spinning back in towards off stump. Goes deep in his crease to punch to long-on, brings up the 50 partnership
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: lovely length close to off stump. Holder isn't really getting a stride forward, just trusting his reach. Blocked into the covers
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Holder, no run

items.text: tossed up a bit higher on off stump, swept to the left of Shakib at deep backward square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Holder, 1 run

items.text: nice flight outside off, stretches out to drive to long-off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: quickish length ball with a bit of flight, clipped from off stump towards midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Holder, no run

items.text: a bit wider, driven to the left of long-off
items.postText:
Thanks Karthik. Bangladesh have come back beautifully into this game thanks to Mehidy, Shakib and Mustafizur - all expected to be match-winners at the World Cup. But this partnership must give West Indies the hope that they can maximise the final overs of the game. They're certainly a team known for their back-end firepower

Shihab: "BD have bowled well, but they lack pedigree in death bowling. Especially with Fizz out of form, since he is the only one who could've been trusted to close out..." --- He's gone very well so far. 

And that will be drinks. It's back to Alagappan for the rest of this innings.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Holder, 1 run

items.text: holds up in the pitch and Holder is far too early with his on-the-up push through point, bat wandering well away from his body. Luckily for him, the ball lands safely to the right of point and scurries away
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Holder, 2 runs

items.text: cuts him in half as Jayed hits the deck and makes the ball seam into the right-hander. Very close to knocking the top of off stump too as Holder tries to flick the ball through midwicket while staying rooted to the crease
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Holder, no run

items.text: another hit-the-deck delivery but Holder manages to do a lot better, reacting to the cut into him by staying on leg stump, giving himself a little room to guided the ball behind point
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Holder, 1 run

items.text: goes fuller to Hope though and he drives sweetly to the sweeper cover
items.postText: James: "35 overs gone, and no 6's from West Indies. Yet." --- Didn't Bravo hit one early on? Hmm, apparently not.
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.text: clips his pads as he tries to work the length ball on middle behind square leg
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Holder, 1 leg bye

items.text: stays leg side of the back of a length ball in line with the stumps and slices it to point
items.postText: PrashantPinku: "I feel playing fats bowling needs courage while playing spinners you need skill too. Cricket today has become a power game. Team playing well when fast bowlers are on suddenly peg back by spinners because they just want to hit them hard rather than milking them or defy them by using their feet."
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Sajib: "Bangladesh has been employing coaches who has enough experience in the immediate next World Cup host country for last 8 years. In this rate, the next coach after this World Cup will be someone from Indian subcontinent or Dav Whatmore (again)"
items.text: shortish and outside off, and Hope makes room to cut it through the covers
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 2 runs

items.text: goes back to the flatter delivery on off stump and turn it to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: tosses it up on off stump and the dip on the ball is enough to keep Holder honest
items.postText: Jack: "I admire Holder quite a lot. He started as a little known young pacer that was thrust unexpectedly into the captaincy. But he managed to stable the team and foster a period of re invigoration in the West Indies against the odds. Salute you sir!"
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Holder, no run

items.text: tries to pinch a run through midwicket, but the good length ball on off stump goes straight to the fielder
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Holder, no run

items.text: waits a little longer to turn the length ball on middle behind square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Holder, 1 run

items.text: tosses it up on off stump, defends
items.postText: Abdullah Hussai: "@Sajib does Tendulkar wants to get into coaching? I'd love him to coach Bangladesh."
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.preText: Windies man: "spin has been an issue for windies but hetmyer and pooran smoke spinners so I don't think we have too much worry there "
items.text: width on offer and Holder gets forward and lashes it to the sweeper cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, 1 run
